main event: Two disc-shaped objects, silvery-white in color and approximately 20 feet in diameter, were observed hovering motionless at an estimated altitude of 5,000 to 7,000 feet over Acton, Texas on November 6, 1968.
interesting points: The objects were observed for approximately 10 minutes before fading from view.
The witnesses, James C. Smith and Allen L. Barnes, were working on a ranch when they first observed the objects.
Both witnesses stated the objects appeared to be metallic in nature.
Two photographs were taken of the objects.
A separate report describes a civilian sighting of a brilliant white light that moved rapidly and then oscillated before disappearing from sight on October 24, 1968 near Acton, Texas.
witnesses: James C. Smith, Allen L. Barnes
